info.title: INTMAX2 Store Vault
info.description:
### Definitions
The INTMAX2 Store Vault service.

post.summary: BackupDeposit processes a request for data backup deposit
post.description: ## This method handles the deposit of backup data.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: BackupDepositRequest is the request message for BackupDeposit method.

get.summary: GetBackupTransactionByHash processes a request for backup transaction by hash
get.description: ## This method handles the backup transaction by hash.

post.summary: GetBackupDepositsList processes a request for backup deposits list with pagination and filters

get.summary: GetBackupBalanceProofs retrieves sender's balance proofs for a given hashes
get.description: ## This method retrieves the sender's balance proofs for the provided hashes.

get.summary: GetBackupTransactions processes a request for backup transactions list
get.description: ## This method handles the backup transactions list.

post.summary: BackupTransaction processes a request for data backup transaction
post.description: ## This method handles the transaction of backup data.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: BackupTransactionRequest is the request message for BackupTransaction method.

get.summary: GetBackupTransactionByHash processes a request for backup transaction by hash
get.description: ## This method handles the backup transaction by hash.

post.summary: GetBackupTransactionsList processes a request for backup transactions list with pagination and filters
BackupTransfer processes a request for data backup transfer
post.description: ## This method handles the transfer of backup data.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: BackupTransferRequest is the request message for BackupTransfer method.

get.summary: GetBackupTransferByHash processes a request for backup transfer by hash
get.description: ## This method handles the backup transfer by hash.

post.summary: GetBackupTransfersList processes a request for backup transfers list with pagination and filters

get.summary: GetBalances retrieves balances for a given address
get.description: ## This method retrieves the balance for the provided address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address to retrieve the balance for

get.summary: GetVerifyDepositConfirmation verifies the confirmation of a deposit
get.description: ## This method verifies if a deposit has been confirmed.

parameters.name: depositId
parameters.description: The ID of the deposit to be verified

get.summary: Version returns the build service info
get.description: ## Version returns the build service info

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

protobufEmpty.title:
A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated
empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request
or the response type of an API method. For instance:

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).
